TopicTitle: KSP RP forum server CPU usage exceeded.

Articles.Content:
> 
> Radion, you might just want to post that backup file on Mediafire and let people download it to extract whatever they want.
> 
> Cheers!
> 
> Capt\'n Skunky
> 
> KSP Community Manager

Oh shoot, you have over 3000 posts, woopey.

Anyways, no, I wouldn\'t recommend it, mainly due to the hilarious amount of information they could get out of it.

> 
> Radion, you might just want to post that backup file on Mediafire and let people download it to extract whatever they want.
> 
> Cheers!
> 
> Capt\'n Skunky
> 
> KSP Community Manager

I wouldn\'t, for privacy concerns. I can\'t parse through the massive text file to locate every single thing, and I am as of yet unsure just how much user information it stored. There could be emails, IP addresses, etc.

> 
> I wouldn\'t, for privacy concerns. I can\'t parse through the massive text file to locate every single thing, and I am as of yet unsure just how much user information it stored. There could be emails, IP addresses, etc.

Is it not just what had been posted? I can\'t imagine there being any information in the file that wasn\'t already publicly available on the forums when it was up.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

> 
> Is it not just what had been posted? I can\'t imagine there being any information in the file that wasn\'t already publicly available on the forums when it was up.
> 
> Cheers!
> 
> Capt\'n Skunky
> 
> KSP Community Manager

No, the backup is a complete compiled database of the entire database that included the memberlist, posted files, configuration, host information, etc. I know this, because during the failed upload when it was incomplete, the memberlist uploaded to the site, and emails, IP\'s, etc where easily visible.

Ah, I see, it\'s a backup of the database from *your* forum. I thought it was a scrape of the old RP forums here.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

So what was the issue with importing? I assume we\'re talking a MySQL table here; was it just too big to go in one go, or is there some missing data that keeps you from re-creating the proper DB schema?

I know a lot of hosts have scripts locked down so a huge MySQL file will time out in the middle of importing, so you have to run the import in batches (excise the part of the dump where it sets up the tables and then break up the section where it adds rows into chunks that can run it less than a minute or whatever the timeout limit is.

> 
> So what was the issue with importing? I assume we\'re talking a MySQL table here; was it just too big to go in one go, or is there some missing data that keeps you from re-creating the proper DB schema?
> 
> I know a lot of hosts have scripts locked down so a huge MySQL file will time out in the middle of importing, so you have to run the import in batches (excise the part of the dump where it sets up the tables and then break up the section where it adds rows into chunks that can run it less than a minute or whatever the timeout limit is.

The file was too big to load in one go. I split the file with 7zip and tried to load them to no avail. I\'ve decided to just run it on a new.

Also, I\'m abandoning the TK sites, I\'m annoyed with them. I\'ve opted for a domain from the webhost that shouldn\'t be too intrusive (the domain name, that is. There is no intrusion on the site iteslf).
yeah it wouldn\'t work just using 7Zip, you need to edit the SQL statements in the actual DB 'dump' file.
What\'s the new website name going to be?

Radion, if you are interested, I can edit that SQL file to do smaller batches if you like.

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky

> 
> Radion, if you are interested, I can edit that SQL file to do smaller batches if you like.
> 
> Arrr!
> 
> Capt\'n Skunky

I would very much appreciate it if you would, thank you.

> 
> Could i possibly have a copy of the test?
I\'ll send it to you now.

> 
> I\'ll send it to you now.

I already did.

> 
> I already did.

Oh XD
Man, this test is harder than my English final!
Well, did it work?

> 
> Man, this test is harder than my English final!

Honestly, this test is easy compared to other tests I\'ve taken... If this was a high school test, I would have probably failed it.
Can we expect to see the site up by the weekend, or will it take longer than that to redo?

> 
> Honestly, this test is easy compared to other tests I\'ve taken... If this was a high school test, I would have probably failed it.

Easy?

Looks like school taught you something.

> 
> Easy?
> 
> Looks like school taught you something.

Flight School, Ground School, and flying from the Stars. Harder than that.

> 
> Flight School, Ground School, and flying from the Stars. Harder than that.

Seventh grade middle school. While never taught about fictional writing.

On topic: waiting for the day in which we can enjoy the worthwhile wait.

> 
> Seventh grade middle school. While never taught about fictional writing.
> 
> On topic: waiting for the day in which we can enjoy the worthwhile wait.

Hell... wonder when it will be back up. Also shan\'t we team up?
Radion, please, *please* play the gaben 'I hope it was worth the wait' soundclip upon logging in for the first time.

this may be a lil off topic based on how this thread was going but got a question

just got done reading the hole thread and kept on seeing something called a test from what i gather it to let people roleplay in the forum.... my question is this.. is this test to be able to sign up and read the forum or is it for posting in it 

if its for posting and reading id like to ask being i utterly stink at spelling and my grammar is very poor.. would there be away for people who just wants to read.. sign up read and not post
